actions.text: On agreeing to the Maloney amendment (A002) as modified Agreed to by voice vote.
The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A002) and on the bill pursuant to the rule.

Maloney amendment (A002) modified by unanimous consent. Modification changes the reporting requirements of the amendment by investing the responsibility for reporting in the Director of National Intelligence.
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A002) offered by Mrs. Maloney.
Amendment agreed to by House: On agreeing to the Maloney amendment (A002) as modified Agreed to by voice vote.
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Maloney amendment (A002) as modified Agreed to by voice vote.

description: Amendment requires the director of National Intelligence to provide written notice to Congress explaining the failure of the executive branch to implement the National Counterterrorism Center, as provided by law, by the deadlines imposed, including the failure by the President to nominate an individual to serve as Director of the National Counterterrorism Center.
purpose: An amendment printed in part B of House Report 109-141 to require the President, if the National Counterterrorism Center (NCTC) is not fully operational by June 17, 2005, to provide Congress written justification as to why the Center is not fully operational. Justification would be required to be updated every thirty days until the NCTC is fully implemented and operational.
